ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: External ear canal mass
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Visible mass in the ear canal with bloody discharge, pain, and flat tympanogram with small ear canal volume.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Combination of sensorineural loss and conductive component due to canal occlusion by the mass.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Determine degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
Assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Evaluate middle ear function and ear canal volume.
Assess integrity of the reflex arc and retrocochlear pathways.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a severe-to-profound mixed hearing loss in the right ear and mild-to-moderate sensorineural loss in the left. The right ear findings include a flat tympanogram with small canal volume, consistent with the reported external ear mass occluding the canal. Speech recognition is excellent when the conductive component is overcome.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Severe mixed loss (250-8000 Hz) with a profound mixed notch at 500 and 1000 Hz. Left ear: Mild rising to slight SNHL (250-4000 Hz) sloping to moderate SNHL (6000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 87 dB HL, WRS 92% at 100 dB HL. Left SRT 30 dB HL, WRS 92% at 70 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Flat (Type B) with small ear canal volume (0.5 mL). Left ear: Normal (Type A, 1.4 mL).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes absent. Left ipsilateral normal; Left contralateral absent.

proposed_items: Surgical removal of the external ear lesion
counseling_actions: Explain the mixed nature of the hearing loss (permanent sensorineural + conductive blockage)
Discuss how the mass is blocking sound and causing the flat tympanogram results
Advise on the necessity of surgical intervention for the mass

escalation.rationale_short: Immediate evaluation and surgical removal of the external ear mass causing pain, bleeding, and hearing loss.

follow_up_plan.objective: Determine any improvement in hearing once the canal is clear.

expected_outcome: The lesion was determined to be an external ear lesion.
The patient was scheduled to have the lesion surgically removed.
A follow-up hearing evaluation was recommended to determine improvement after surgery.
